input_text:
Job Title: Senior Partner Manager

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

 Position Type : Full time

 Type Of Hire : Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)

 Education Desired : Bachelor of Arts

 Travel Percentage : 1 - 5%

Job Description

About Worldpay

At Worldpay, our goal is to solve all the ecommerce and payment needs for merchants of all types and sizes worldwide. We serve large and fast-growing companies with their complex and tailored payment needs supported by vertical expertise in their specific business. Our solutions also provide local in-store, online and mobile payment acceptance solutions for merchants, from large corporates to small and medium-sized enterprises and micro merchants with a focus on integrated payments for SMEs/SMBs.

Worldpay has been privately owned by the leading private equity group GTCR since February this year, and since then we have been striving to bring greater levels of value, innovation, and service to clients through increased investment in product, technology, and client solutions. The company also plans to pursue strategic acquisitions across verticals and geographies to further enhance its ability to serve clients and expand its market opportunities.

About The Team

The Strategic Partnerships team tackles partnerships that drive key growth areas for the business with impact across all segments. We are a small but mighty team in the Chief Strategy Office that works on Worldpay’s most important partnerships – analyzing where we need to partner, identifying and assessing key partnership opportunities, structuring commercial deals, and in where needed, managing partner relationships. This role will be focused on our Product Partnerships in particular, looking at partners who can bring additional value to existing and new merchants through new and interesting technology and services.

What you will be doing

The Senior Partner Manager Does The Following Activities

What We Offer You

FIS is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive compensation. The pay range for this full-time position is $94,720.00 - $156,280.00 and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this position based on the posted role, level, and location. Within the range, actual individual starting pay is determined additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Any changes in work location will also impact actual individual starting pay. Please consult with your recruiter about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Develop and execute partner strategy: analyze internal capabilities and external market factors to determine where we need to partner, who to partner with, how to structure partnerships, etc.Lead all aspects of deal execution with support: identifying and prioritizing targets, business case development, deal structuring, negotiating terms and contracts, and closingCollaborate across segments: liaise with Product, Sales, Commercial and Strategy teams and other areas of the business to gather input and ensure alignment on the partners we pursueEnsure the success of your partnerships and work with the partner and stakeholders at Worldpay to launch and grow the partnershipHave the autonomy to explore other potential partnerships that can deliver additional capabilities to our existing suite of products and services, and hence additional value to our merchants The ideal candidate will have a combination of the following:2-3+ years of sales experience in a business development (preferred) or a relationship management role, ideally in a technology or fin tech spaceA track record of signing and launching new partnerships with tangible business value and revenue impact, ideally in a technology or fin tech spaceProven ability to assess potential partnerships with a strategic lens; thinking through use cases, value proposition, what that means for the business case, and what tangible business benefit it provides in the short and long termStrong aptitude for establishing and maintaining effective working relationships and the ability to interact effectively with people at all levels of Worldpay as well as client/partner organizationsAdded bonus if you are currently in the payments industry in the US or UK and have a general knowledge of how the payments ecosystem worksAbility to travel 20-30%A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities. We love giving internal candidates the opportunity to move into other areas of the business and take on new roles and opportunitiesThe chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology. Worldpay is the largest acquirer in the world – we serve some of the biggest merchants and solve their most pertinent problemsA fantastic range of benefits designed to help support your lifestyle and wellbeingA broad range of professional education and personal development opportunitiesThe opportunity to interface with senior executives at Worldpay and at potential/existing partner organizationsA competitive salary and benefits
Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

EEOC Statement

FIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here supplement document available here

For positions located in the US, the following conditions apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test. ADA Disclaimer: In developing this job description care was taken to include all competencies needed to successfully perform in this position. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

#pridepass

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
